location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 127, Translation of a letter from Jaffer Khan, at his camp near Kawzaroon, to the Bushire Residency

mods.abstract: This letter, which is dated in the month Saffir, in the year of the Hejira 1201, was received 24 December 1786. The letter reports the arrival of two European gentlemen (John Morrison and John Bigges) at Jaffer Khan's camp who claimed to have been sent by the King of England and to have business with Jaffer Khan. The pair are said to be awaiting the arrival of Gofur Beg (representing the King of India) and so Jaffer Khan has sent them to Bushire to await his arrival.
